channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SPR-4081] Return type of o.s.b.f.x.XmlBeanDefinitionReader#getReader() changed
item.description:
The return type of o.s.b.f.x.XmlBeanDefinitionReader#getReader() has changed from

org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader

to

org.springframework.beans.factory.support.BeanDefinitionReader

If you use this method you have to recompile your code, otherwise you get following exception:

org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanDefinitionStoreException: Unexpected exception parsing XML document from ServletContext resource [/WEB-INF/applicationContext.xml]; nested exception is java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlReaderContext.getReader()Lorg/springframework/beans/factory/xml/XmlBeanDefinitionReader;
at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.doLoadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:385)
at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:313)
at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:290)
at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.java:142)
at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.java:158)
at org.springframework.web.context.support.XmlWebApplicationContext.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlWebApplicationContext.java:124)
at org.springframework.web.context.support.XmlWebApplicationContext.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlWebApplicationContext.java:92)
at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractRefreshableApplicationContext.refreshBeanFactory(AbstractRefreshableApplicationContext.java:97)
at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext.obtainFreshBeanFactory(AbstractApplicationContext.java:411)
at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext.refresh(AbstractApplicationContext.java:338)
at org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoader.createWebApplicationContext(ContextLoader.java:245)
at org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoader.initWebApplicationContext(ContextLoader.java:188)
at org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoaderListener.contextInitialized(ContextLoaderListener.java:45)

Since this change prevents you from just dropping in the new Spring libs into your application, I marked this report as "blocker".

BTW, I'm not the only one who run into this problem: See also https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/XBEAN-88

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I wasn't aware that XBeans uses that "getReader()" method. I don't remember anybody raising that issue with us before, despite the change going back to 2.1 M1.

Since the change of return type was only really for improved internal decoupling, I've simply changed it to expose the XmlBeanDefinitionReader again (for backwards compatibility with Spring 2.0.x).

Juergen
I don't think 2.5 is being claimed as a perfect drop-in replacement. If you're recompiling already, I'd rather have the improved internal decoupling and force the recompile.

Fair enough, Paul... However, the problem here is that pre-compiled third-party libraries such as XBean cannot be easily recompiled. They'd rather have to release a new version for Spring 2.5, which is not what we typically want to force them to. In particular since higher-level third-party products such as ActiveMQ in turn build on XBean...

FWIW, we had a similar request for Spring 2.0 final, where we reintroduced some old SPI for full backwards compatibility - in particular with respect to XBean. This XmlBeanDefinitionReader reference is not too bad a tradeoff, since the stronger coupling only affects the "beans.factory.xml" package internally. Which is why I consider it worth reverting that code to its original signature.

Juergen
